Articles.Content: Space.com takes a look at Kerbal Space Program, available for PC, Mac, and Linux. This semi-realistic build it and fly it rocket simulator lets you piece together your own rocket and launch it into space while hopefully not exploding along the way. Edited July 31, 2013 by shuttle099
thats a very good review.. but the space sations shows the lag jeje

Very awesome that SPACE.COM has picked this up. That site has a HUGE audience of both young and old. I mean just promoting it through my FACEBOOK with my screenshots and achievements have addicted at least 5-6 people that I know of.
I am a regular reader of space.com and was glad to see this. I almost posted the link but see you have beat me to it. I am surprised it took them that long to notice

lol

"You can cluster together an absurd number of engines and... just... see how she does!"
Yeah its really good to see the mainstream space media picking this up. Great exposure without any costs for Squad. This is how marketing should be done!
This isn't going to be the new Minecraft. Think more on the lines of an ultra-hyped triple-a title. Yes. I think it will be that popular. Maybe very soon.
